repository.corpname: California Institute of Technology Archives and Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz. Comet Whipple was observed in this record beginning on page 49. Comet Wilke was observed in this record beginning on page 47. On page 79 there's a note that Supernova in IC 4182 was discovered on this film.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz. There's a note on page 101 that supernova in IC 4182 was being observed exactly one year after discovery. There's a note on page 139 that a slow meteor with a visible trail was caught on a picture. Page 145 indicates that Supernova no.6 in a barred spiral was marked.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz. Page 7 indicates that observers took the first picture of Supernova NGC4636 on this night. Pages 11-15 indicates a Supernova was observed in NGC 4636.Page 45-61 indicates that Supernova 4621 was observed. Page 129 notes that a search was done for Harvard nebula NGC 2474-2475. Page 141 indicates that Supernova in NGC 5907 was observed. The last page indicates that there are a total of 1028 photographs in this record.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz; Duncan, Dr.; Weaver, Harold F. [?]. There's are notes on pages 3-7 about observing a Supernova in 5907. On page 13, 21, 61, 65 supernova in NGC 4725 is observed. On pages 15-17 a Supernova in IC 1099 is observed. Dr. Duncan observes on page 45. Mr. Weaver observes on page 57. On page 99 Comet Cunningham is observed. Page 11 notes a Supernova in NGC 253. Page 135 notes a Supernova in NGC 3254. The last page indicates that there are a total of 1052 photographs in this record.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz; Weaver. Page 9 indicates pictures were taken of Comet van den Gent. The last page indicates that there are 938 photographs in this record.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz; Johnson; Wilson; Rule; Nicholson; Olsen. Page 13 indicates that pictures taken are part of Virgo Cluster Program.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Wilson; Nicholson; Johnson; Herzog, E.; Zwicky, Fritz; Whittlesey; Duncan; Omer-Mills. The last page indicates that there are 991 exposures in this record.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Herzog, E.; Zwicky, Fritz; Whittlesey. On page 98, while Zwicky is observing there's a note that the Prism is On. The last page indicates that there are 967 exposures in this record.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Zwicky, Fritz; Gates, H.S.; Herzog, E.; Holmberg; Wild, Paul. The first page indicates that the total pictures taken in this book is 968.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Gates, H.S.; Wild, Paul; Holmberg; Zwicky, Fritz. Page 58 notes images of Haro's 1952 novae. Starting on page 72 Wild observers nova fields 1-16. There are notes on pages 200+ about the Seeing Project and Program. On page 224 theres a note about a supernova discovered by Paul Wild, a visiting astronomer from Switzerland, in NGC 5668. Page 232 includes a note about Comet Abell, 1953g being photographed. Page 248 includes a note about a Supernova in 4214. Page 250 includes notes from Observer Gates about a Comet Search program.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Gates, H.S.; Wild, Paul; Duncan; Feige; Zwicky, Fritz; Herzog, E.; Russell, J.A. Comet Peter Cherbak (157d) was observed in this record on page 194. Blue Star Program mentioned on page 54. There are a lot of supernova observations in this record. Comet Arend-Roland is observed on page 164. Comet Schwass-Wach is observed on page 240.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Observers include Gates, H.S.; Herzog, E.; Rudnicki, K.; Gomes.

bioghist.p: Observers include Gates, H.S.; Herzog, E.; Rudnicki, K.; Kowal; Kocher; van Woerden, H.
